# Opal Data Dictionary with R

This is an example of how to use **knitr** for producing a data dictionary on data stored in [Opal](http://wiki.obiba.org/display/OPALDOC).

```{r echo=FALSE,message=FALSE}
library(opal)
o <- opal.login('administrator', 'password', 'http://demo.obiba.org:8080')
```

Assign some variables into a data.frame with associated *D* symbol in R on Opal server side:

```{r, comment=""}
variables <- opal.variables(o, datasource='onyx', table='StandingHeight')
opal.assign(o,'D','onyx.StandingHeight')
```

## Variables

```{r run-variable-md, include=FALSE}
out = NULL
for (variable in variables) {
  out = c(out, knit_child('opal-variable.Rmd'), sep='\n')
}
```

`r paste(out, collapse='\n')`

```{r results=FALSE,echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(o)
```
